This exercise demonstrates the importance of sufficient color contrast in UI elements. Text with low color contrast can be difficult to read, especially for users with visual impairments. Different requirements apply to different sizes of text.
This is regular-sized text (smaller than 18pt or 14pt bold). According to WCAG guidelines, small text should have a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1 against its background for good readability.
This is large text (18pt or larger, or 14pt bold or larger). According to WCAG guidelines, large text only needs a contrast ratio of at least 3:1 against its background to be considered accessible.

Try using an accessibility scanning tool to detect these contrast issues. Tools like Android\'s Accessibility Scanner can identify elements with insufficient contrast and differentiate between requirements for small and large text.

This exercise demonstrates how to create an accessible list with favorite icons. Each item can be marked as favorite by clicking the icon. The icons have proper content descriptions to ensure screen readers can announce their purpose correctly.
